Package com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle

Class Avatar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.waddle_ware.heslington_hustle.Avatar
  • public class Avatar
extends java.lang.Object
    The Avatar class represents the player's character in the game. It manages the player's movement, collision detection, and rendering.

        Constructs an Avatar object.
        Parameters:
        plyr_x - The initial x-coordinate of the player.
        plyr_y - The initial y-coordinate of the player.
        world_height - The height of the game world.
        world_width - The width of the game world.

        Parameters:
        tile_map - The TiledMap representing the game map.

                        float oldX,
                        float oldY)
        Handles collisions between the player and the game map.
        Parameters:
        tile_map - The TiledMap representing the game map.
        oldX - The previous x-coordinate of the player.
        oldY - The previous y-coordinate of the player.

      • render

        public void render​(com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer renderer)
        Renders the player character on the game screen.
        Parameters:
        renderer - The OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer used for rendering.

      • handleInput

        public void handleInput()
        Handles user input to control the player movement. Accelerates player's velocity in the appropriate direction when movement keys are pressed. Friction is applied independently in x,y directions based on whether movement keys are pressed. The player's velocity is clamped to prevent it from exceeding the maximum velocity.

      • getPlayerX

        public float getPlayerX()
        Retrieves the current x-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the player.

        Retrieves the current y-coordinate of the player.
        Returns:

        public void setPlayerLoc​(float x,
                         float y)
        Sets the location of the player to the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate to set.
        y - The y-coordinate to set.

        Cleans up resources associated with the Avatar object.
